II. Purpose of Addendum
To expand its foster care services and provide convenience to families, Methodist
Children’s Home Society has requested to add a satellite office to its existing office
in Redford.
III. Methodology
I responded to the Chief Administrator’s request and virtually toured the new office
space on July 30, 2020.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The new office space is in a two-story building in north central Detroit located at
2470 Collingwood St, Detroit, Michigan 48206. The main crossroads are Linwood
and Davison. Methodist is renting six suites in the building from the City of Detroit
as part of a renovation project called Durfee Innovation Center, formerly known as
Detroit Central High School. Methodist shares the building with other
companies/organizations that also rent suites.
There is a free gated parking lot open during business hours and locked after
hours. A security guard stands at the front entrance to the building where visitors
and patrons must sign in.
On the first floor, Suite 122 has six three-sided office cubicles and a locking file
cabinet for CHRI documents. Suite 124 has three supervisor offices. Suite 114
has a large conference room. Suite 110 has four supervisor offices. On the
second floor, Suite 217 has two visiting rooms furnished with couches and a play
area with toys. Suite 207 has a staff lounge with a refrigerator and microwave.
There is Wifi throughout the building. There is no cabinet to store foster child
records. Hard copy files will be maintained at the Redford location and will not be
transported to the Detroit office. Family visits will be offered in spaces at both
locations.
V. Recommendation
I recommend this satellite office be added to Methodist’s existing license and
opened for business.
